turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I think it's time to get out of here.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: It's Domini, it's not Domini, I don't care--all I know is <u>I'm</u> not dealing with something--<u>anything</u>-- snuffing me in my sleep. I want to do what we did in the woods-- surveillance of this whole place 24/7, with somebody monitoring those cameras every second. There's something, somebody here, I want to see 'em coming.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I thought all your equipment got stolen.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: All the shit that was worth anything, yes. You'd be amazed, though, what you can get free on the 'net.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: Just let it go, I've got you!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Maybe whatever they are, they just haven't appeared yet on her?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Ruins of the Rustin Parr house.

turns.speaker: DOMINI
turns.text: Guy who killed all the kids in the '40s.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: We're doing dusk-till-dawn taping of all the places where there've been alleged Blair Witch "sightings" --the Parr House, Coffin Rock, Tappy Creek.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: See what turns up--which I guarantee will be nothing. Some of the rest of the party are more hopeful--

turns.speaker: DOMINI
turns.text: I thought the movie was bitchin'.

turns.speaker: DOMINI
turns.text: Look at those marks--just like in the movie.

turns.speaker: DOMINI
turns.text: Rusty Parr had the right idea on child care.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You planning on sleeping out there?

turns.speaker: DOMINI
turns.text: Not planning on sleeping at all.

turns.speaker: DOMINI
turns.text: Ripped? They look like they were <u>bit</u> off.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: That's almost a year's worth of work!  Scumbags! Oh, Jesus, Jesus....

turns.speaker: DOMINI
turns.text: At least you still have the tapes.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Someone want to tell me what's going on--

turns.speaker: DOMINI
turns.text: --and we brought it back with us!

turns.speaker: DOMINI
turns.text: The four of you really have too much spare fucking time on your hands, don't you?

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: And what's your excuse for being here?

turns.speaker: DOMINI
turns.text: Hmm? I dunno. Chafing from the backpack, something.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: That'd be up on your shoulder, maybe your lower back.

turns.speaker: DOMINI
turns.text: Motion. Stop there. Play it again.

turns.speaker: DOMINI
turns.text: There is something <u>there</u>--don't ask, just trust me.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Two-to-one he dusts the keyboard for fingerprints the second he gets back.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: At least go drink it somewhere spilling it won't drive him to suicide.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: What is it you thought you saw on that tape?

turns.speaker: DOMINI
turns.text: No. Elly Kedward's not the problem here, I don't think. She was just a good old-fashioned white witch--

turns.speaker: DOMINI
turns.text: It touched me, don't you see it now?

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Slow it down, slow it down, whatever it is, we'll figure it out.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: No big deal. I'm just trying to understand.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: I think you closed the bar again. I'll have to go out.

turns.speaker: DOMINI
turns.text: Go to the store. When you get back, I'll try to make sense of it for you.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: What're you afraid's going to happen?

turns.speaker: DOMINI
turns.text: That they'll start touching us inside our heads.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: --she wasn't a witch--we embrace nature, not evil--

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: The good old days: toasting marsh- mallows over a burning witch.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: They never burned witches in this country, they hanged them.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Whatever--all I know is the persecution's going to start all over again, they keep pumping out inflammatory bullshit like this fucking movie--

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Finally got her back to sleep.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Nick, what you should do is get her back up and get her to a goddamn <u>doctor</u>.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Jesus, you don't think I know that? You don't think I've tried? She won't fucking <u>go</u>-- she won't leave this place.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Yeah, I know. It's...alright. We're all a little--

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You think....there could've been something up in those woods that Anna--

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: --it's not a could've--there <u>was</u>, Nick. And it fucked up Anna, and did something to Domini, and it caused my father to die, and it's here <u>with</u> us in this place <u>now</u>. And I don't have one single idea in hell what's going to happen next, just that it's going to happen to one of us. And then the other. And then the other. It's going to get into our <u>brains</u>.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: There's explanations. Rational explanations for everything that's happened. We'll drive ourselves crazy if we keep obsessing on supernatural what-ifs.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: That feels good. Lower--down into my neck.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I dunno it's anything. It's a name Anna's mentioned--from her dreams.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Hey, chemicals, fear, sleep- deprivation--and a round-the-clock obsession with the occult--hell've a recipe for a mind-fuck.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: We are being fucked with here, someone or something.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: --why in the world would she just fly the coop in the first place?

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: We're not dealing with fucking logic here!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Don't! You're making me lose my grip.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Or a blood blister--or a bruise.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Put 'em together that's a "k." James Kurth--

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: --or Lyme Disease or poison sumac, or God knows what-else we could have picked up in the woods.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: You <u>know</u> what we picked up in the woods--

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I thought all witches were benign and good.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What the fuck's going on here?

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Does she have marks, Nick--like the ones we have, that Domini had?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Not that I've seen--but that has no meaning--that means nothing.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: --the marks appear, then you disappear. Like the little Kurth boy, like Domini, as soon as they come to full bloom--and mine <u>are</u>!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: There are <u>other</u> explanations! She is not the goddamn witch, that's insane!

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Then just give me one of your explanations that all three of us'll buy.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Yes! I need to speak to Sheriff Von Teer.

turns.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE
turns.text: He's in a meeting. Could I have him--

turns.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE
turns.text: Could I tell him what it's regarding?

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: His daughter, for God's sake-- I need to know if he's heard from her this morning.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: I'm talking to Taos, New Mexico--

turns.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE
turns.text: --yes, Ma'am, can I help you with anything else?--

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: --his name's Von Teer! His daughter's named Domini!--

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: She wants me to talk to you, Heather.

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: There was an accident early this morning. Another car. Your father's injuries were fatal.

turns.speaker: MAN'S VOICE
turns.text: I'll tell your mother not to expect you at the funeral.

turns.speaker: ABBY
turns.text: Listen Meurice, you're gonna help me with a problem.

turns.speaker: ABBY
turns.text: You're gonna keep an eye on Marty and Ray, make sure nothing happens.

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: Any time. But you don't have to worry about a thing for a while. Marty went down to Corpus yesterday.

turns.speaker: ABBY
turns.text: I... I'm sorry, Meurice. I gotta talk to you... Can I come in?

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: Jesus, I got a hangover. Want a drink?

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: ...For you I answer the door. If you wanna stay here, that's fine. But I'm retired.

turns.speaker: ABBY
turns.text: Something happened with Marty and Ray--

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: ...Ray stole a shitload of money from Marty. Until both of 'em calm down I'm not getting involved.

turns.speaker: ABBY
turns.text: No Meurice, it's worse than that. Something really happened, I think Marty's dead--

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: What?! Did Ray tell you that?

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: ...I mean, I don't know where he is, but he ain't dead.

turns.speaker: MEURICE
turns.text: You don't look too good. You sleep last night?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Why d'you wanna leave all this?

turns.speaker: ABBY
turns.text: You kidding? I don't wanna leave all this, I just wanna leave Marty...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You can stay at my place, I'll drop you there.

turns.speaker: ABBY
turns.text: Don't go to the bar, Ray. I know him, that ain't a good idea.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I just gotta see a guy.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: On the phone. Was it for you?

turns.speaker: ABBY
turns.text: I don't know, he didn't say anything.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Uh-huh. So how do you know it was a he?

turns.speaker: ABBY
turns.text: You got a girl--am I screwing something up by being here?

turns.speaker: ABBY
turns.text: ...I can find a place tomorrow, then I'll be outta your hair.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: If that's what you want to do, then you oughta do it. You, uh... you want the bed or the couch?

turns.speaker: ABBY
turns.text: Well... the couch would be all right...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You can sleep on the bed if you want.

turns.speaker: ABBY
turns.text: Well... I'm not gonna put you out of your bed...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You wouldn't be putting me out.

turns.speaker: ABBY
turns.text: I could've sworn I heard something.

turns.speaker: ABBY
turns.text: I knew it. 'Cause we wouldn't have heard anything if it was him. He's real careful. Fact is, he's anal.

turns.speaker: ABBY
turns.text: Yeah, he told me once himself. He said to me...

turns.speaker: ABBY
turns.text: ...He sent me to a psychiatrist to see if he could calm me down some.

turns.speaker: ABBY
turns.text: Psychiatrist said I was the healthiest person he'd ever met, so Marty fired him.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: ...I don't know if you can fire a psychiatrist, exactly.

turns.speaker: ABBY
turns.text: Well, I didn't see him anymore, I'll tell you that much.

turns.speaker: ABBY
turns.text: I said, Marty, how come you're anal and I gotta go to the psychiatrist?

turns.speaker: ABBY
turns.text: Nothing. He's like you, he doesn't say much.

turns.speaker: ABBY
turns.text: Except when he doesn't say things they're usually nasty.

turns.speaker: ABBY
turns.text: When you don't they're usually nice.

turns.speaker: ABBY
turns.text: Huh? Oh, yeah, I guess. Mm-hmm.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I don't know. It's early... I love you.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I don't know. I better get off now.

turns.speaker: ABBY
turns.text: Why didn't you get into bed?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I didn't think I could sleep. I'm surprised you could. Are you all right?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: ...I just wanted to let you know that everything was all right. I took care of everything. Now all we have to do is keep our heads.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I cleaned it all up, but that ain't important...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: ...Anyway, we got some time now. But we gotta be smart.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Abby, never point a gun at anyone unless you're gonna shoot him. And when you shoot him you better make sure he's dead...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: ...That's the only thing they told us in the service that was worth a goddamn--Where the hell's my windbreaker?

turns.speaker: ABBY
turns.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

turns.speaker: ABBY
turns.text: I... I mean what're you talking about, Ray? I haven't done anything funny.

turns.speaker: ABBY
turns.text: ...But first I gotta know what happened.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What do you want to know?

turns.speaker: ABBY
turns.text: You broke into the bar. You wanted to get your money. You and Marty had a fight. Something happened...

turns.speaker: ABBY
turns.text: ...I don't know, wasn't it you? Maybe a burglar broke in, and you found--

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: If he does come in I'm not here... What were you drinking, Debra?

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: You've got a very sophisticated palate.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: Give Debra here another drink, and give me the usual.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: Listen, I got tickets for the Oilers and the Rams next week in the Astrodome. Ever sat on the fifty yard line?

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: You won't have to. I'll explain what a palate is.

turns.speaker: DEBRA
turns.text: You won't have to. I just wanted to see if you knew.

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: So how long have you know Meurice?

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: We don't seem to be communicating--

turns.speaker: DEBRA
turns.text: You want to hustle me. I don't want to be hustled. It's as simple as that. Now that I've communicated, why don't you leave?

turns.speaker: MARTY
turns.text: I'm not surprised, the company you've been keeping the last ten years.
